Meetings.Raw: The speakers on Monday next , November 3 , at the Knightsbridge Hall , at 3.15 p.m. , will be Mr. H. Baillie Weaver and Mrs. Mansel . Mrs. Dacre Fox will be in the chair . It is also hoped that it may be possible for Miss Annie Kenney to be present .
The meeting on Thursday evening will be held at the Elysée Galleries , Queen's Road , Bayswater , at 8 p.m. The speakers will be the Rev. John M. Maillard , Mrs. Dacre Fox , and others .
Mrs. Davies spoke at Putney , Werter Road , on Friday .

Will all members who can come to office on Friday and Saturday , at 8 p.m. , to go out chalking and billing for meeting at Devonshire Hall ; also weekly members ' meeting , Wednesday , 8 p.m. ? Stewards urgently needed for meeting Monday , Nov. 3.
Members again reminded of large meeting in Constitu- tional Hall , Green Lanes , Harringay , Nov. 13.
Mrs. Thomson kindly offered to have first one on Thursday evening , Nov. 27 , 7.30 p.m. Miss Evelyn Sharp has kindly consented to speak .
Will all members make a point of attend ing meeting at Stratford Town Hall
On Wednesday , Nov. 5 , 8 p.m. , a meet- ing for women will be held in Horbury Rooms ( see meetings list ) . Canvassers urgently wanted for this meeting
every effort must be concentrated on Athenæum meeting on Nov. 20 ; speakers , Mr. Scurr , Miss Richards , and Miss Nancy Lightman .
Next meeting at Malvern , Nov. 13.
Will members make a good rally and bring friends to Miss Arnie Williams ' meeting , Thursday , Nov. 6
Lady Isabel Margesson's meeting , Nov. 11 , at Assembly Rooms , 8 p.m.
Tuesday , Nov. 4 , 8 p.m. , Miss Daukes , " Children's Questions and How They Should Be Answered . "
The Rev. Hattie Baker will speak on the White Slave Traffic , Nov. 24 , 8.15 . Name of hall to be announced later .
Will mem- bers kindly remind working women of their meeting on Monday , Nov. 3 , at Rain- bow Hall , Siverhill ?
meeting at Aber- sychan , Thursday , Nov. 13 , 8 p.m. , Miss Hicks , M.A.
Thursday , Nov. 27 , at Grif - hithstown , M'ss Barbara Wylie .
bring friend to Trades Union Club . Nov. 3
Will members make an effort to bring outsiders Nov. 82 to " At Home , "

Meetings.Raw: Please remember dance , Collinson's Café , King Edward Street , Nov. 12.
Miss Katherine Margesson has kindly consented to speak Thursday even- ing , Nov. 20 , at Small Co - operative Hall
Protest meeting against forcible feeding and " Cat - and - Mouse Act , " Corn Ex- change , Wednesday . Nov. 12 , 8 p.m.

PROTEST MEETING at CAXTON HALL , Westminster , MONDAY , NOV . 3 , 8 p.m. ( during Suffrage Week of Prayer ) . Speakers : C. Man- sell - Moullin , F.R.C. , cn " Forcible Feeding " ; Mrs. Hylton Dale , Miss Jones , Mrs. Davies .
